about.name: Mexico City
about.info_text: Mexico City, often referred to as CDMX, is the capital and largest city of Mexico. It is a dynamic and culturally rich metropolis known for its historic architecture, vibrant street life, and a culinary scene that's recognized worldwide. With a history dating back to the Aztec civilization, the city is a blend of tradition and modernity. Visitors can explore ancient ruins, colonial-era buildings, and contemporary art galleries while enjoying delicious Mexican cuisine and diverse neighborhoods.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 21.9 million (metropolitan area)
State: Mexico City
Time Zone: Central Time Zone (UTC-06:00)
Language: Spanish
Currency: Mexican Peso (MXN)
about.climate_text: Mexico City enjoys a temperate highland climate with mild, dry winters and pleasant summers. The city's elevation of 2,240 meters (7,350 feet) above sea level ensures a relatively consistent climate year-round.

attractions_card.title: Zócalo
attractions_card.description: The Zócalo is the historic main square of Mexico City and is surrounded by impressive historic buildings, including the Metropolitan Cathedral and the National Palace.

attractions_card.title: Teotihuacán
attractions_card.description: Teotihuacán is an ancient Mesoamerican city known for its monumental pyramids, the Pyramid of the Sun and the Pyramid of the Moon, and is a UNESCO World Heritage site.

attractions_card.title: Frida Kahlo Museum
attractions_card.description: The Frida Kahlo Museum, also known as the Blue House (Casa Azul), is the former home of the iconic Mexican artist and is now a museum displaying her art and personal belongings.

attractions_card.title: Chapultepec Park
attractions_card.description: Chapultepec Park is one of the largest city parks in the world, featuring museums, a zoo, a castle, and beautiful green spaces for leisure and relaxation.

attractions_card.title: Xochimilco
attractions_card.description: Xochimilco is known for its colorful canals and traditional trajineras (flat-bottomed boats). Visitors can enjoy a leisurely ride through the canals and experience local culture.

attractions_card.title: National Museum of Anthropology
attractions_card.description: The National Museum of Anthropology is one of the most important museums in Mexico, showcasing a vast collection of pre-Columbian art and artifacts.

attractions_card.title: Palacio de Bellas Artes
attractions_card.description: Palacio de Bellas Artes is a stunning cultural center with a distinctive Art Nouveau and Art Deco architectural style, hosting art exhibitions and performances.

attractions_card.title: Coyoacán
attractions_card.description: Coyoacán is a historic neighborhood with a bohemian atmosphere, known for its cobblestone streets, markets, and the Casa Azul (Frida Kahlo Museum).

food_card.title: Tacos
food_card.description: Tacos are a beloved Mexican street food, with various fillings such as carne asada, al pastor, and carnitas, served in soft tortillas with fresh toppings.

food_card.title: Mole Poblano
food_card.description: Mole Poblano is a rich and flavorful sauce made from chocolate and chili peppers, often served over chicken or turkey.

food_card.title: Chiles en Nogada
food_card.description: Chiles en Nogada is a traditional Mexican dish featuring poblano peppers stuffed with a mix of meats and fruits, topped with walnut cream sauce.

food_card.title: Tamales
food_card.description: Tamales are a staple of Mexican cuisine, made from masa (corn dough) filled with various ingredients and wrapped in corn husks before steaming.

food_card.title: Mexican Street Corn (Elote)
food_card.description: Elote is grilled corn on the cob smothered in mayonnaise, cheese, chili powder, and lime juice, creating a flavorful and savory treat.

hotels_card.title: Four Seasons Hotel Mexico City
hotels_card.description: The Four Seasons Hotel in Mexico City offers luxurious accommodations, fine dining, and a central location in the upscale Polanco district.

hotels_card.title: St. Regis Mexico City
hotels_card.description: The St. Regis Mexico City is a sophisticated hotel with panoramic city views, elegant rooms, and exceptional service.

hotels_card.title: Condesa DF
hotels_card.description: Condesa DF is a boutique hotel in the trendy Condesa neighborhood, featuring stylish rooms and a rooftop terrace with great views.

hotels_card.title: Gran Hotel Ciudad de Mexico
hotels_card.description: The Gran Hotel Ciudad de Mexico is a historic hotel overlooking the Zócalo, offering classic elegance and impressive interior architecture.

hotels_card.title: W Mexico City
hotels_card.description: W Mexico City is a contemporary and trendy hotel in the upscale Polanco district, known for its vibrant design and nightlife.

transport_card.title: Mexico City Metro
transport_card.description: The Mexico City Metro is one of the largest and busiest metro systems in the world, providing an affordable and efficient way to get around the city.

transport_card.title: Ecobici (Bike Share)
transport_card.description: Ecobici is Mexico City's bike-sharing program, allowing visitors to rent bicycles for eco-friendly transportation within the city.

transport_card.title: Rideshare Services
transport_card.description: Rideshare services like Uber and Didi are widely available in Mexico City, offering convenient and safe transportation options.

transport_card.title: Benito Juárez International Airport
transport_card.description: Benito Juárez International Airport (MEX) is the primary airport serving Mexico City, connecting the city to domestic and international destinations.
